Source.Name: optipng
Source.Description: OptiPNG is a PNG optimizer that recompresses image files to a smaller size, without losing any information. This program also converts external formats (BMP, GIF, PNM and TIFF) to optimized PNG, and performs PNG integrity checks and corrections.

Update.Comment: Version bump to 0.6.5: * Upgraded libpng to version 1.4.5-optipng [private] * Upgraded zlib to version 1.2.5-optipng [private] * Fixed the I/O states (in libpng 1.4.5); they caused incorrect file reads in some rare cases. * Fixed processing of PNG files with chunks of size 0. * Fixed a display error in the TIFF import. * Improved checking of the arguments of -f, -zc, -zm and -zs. * Removed quirks from the rangeset option argument syntax. * Fixed a build issue under the system-supplied libpng-1.4. * Resolved forward-compatibility issues regarding libpng-1.5; however, the system-supplied libpng-1.5 is not yet supported. * Added various enhancements to the configure+make build system.
Update.Name: Gökçen Eraslan

Update.Comment: Version bump to 0.6.4: * Added the option -nx. * Clarified the behavior of -nz and the relation between -nz and -o0. * Added a filesystem check (resolving normalized paths, symlinks, etc.) to better detect when the output overwrites the input.
